page.title: 01BADBURY RINGS-CONSERVATION
page.content: In{1976}it was decided to restore {BADBURY RINGS.}This included restricting cars to certain areas and certain hours,the restoration of the actual rings themselves,the appointment of a full time warden,restoration of the ecology and reintoduction of sheep on the rings. The site was left to the{NATIONAL {TRUST }in{1982 }as a part of the {Banks Kingston Lacey estate.}Several trusts have contributed.The most famous of them are the Prince's trust. THE{PRINCE OF WALES,}who worked in {the }summer of{1984}with the {ROYAL {ENGINEERS}to restore the fallen parts of the rings and{Prince Charles visited the rings at this time. Grass seeds have been used to restore the land.It then forms a mat through which the new grass grows.
